intro: Gymnantha, commonly known as the silky oak, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plants are characterized by their large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Gymnantha species often have a woody stem and produce capsules as their fruit. They are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
